==Events==
* [[320]] &ndash; [[Pappus of Alexandria]], Greek philosopher, observes an [[eclipse]] of the [[sun]] and writes a commentary on ''The Great Astronomer'' (''[[Almagest]]'').
* [[614]] &ndash; King [[Chlothar II]] promulgates the [[Edict of Paris]] (''Edictum Chlotacharii''), a sort of Frankish [[Magna Carta]] that defend the rights of the [[Franks|Frankish]] nobles while it [[Antisemitism|exclude Jews]] from all civil employment in the [[Francia|Frankish Kingdom]].
* [[629]] &ndash; King [[Dagobert I]] is crowned [[King of the Franks]].
*[[1009]] &ndash; The [[Church of the Holy Sepulchre]], a Christian [[Church (building)|church]] in [[Jerusalem]], is completely destroyed by the [[Fatimid]] [[caliph]] [[Al-Hakim bi-Amr Allah]], who hacks the Church's foundations down to [[bedrock]].
*[[1016]] &ndash; The [[Danish people|Dane]]s defeat the [[Saxon people|Saxon]]s in the [[Battle of Assandun]].
*[[1081]] &ndash; The [[Normans]] defeat the [[Byzantine Empire]] in the [[Battle of Dyrrhachium (1081)|Battle of Dyrrhachium]].
*[[1210]] &ndash; Pope [[Innocent III]] excommunicates German leader [[Otto IV]].
*[[1356]] &ndash; [[Basel earthquake]], the most significant historic seismological event north of the Alps, destroys the town of [[Basel, Switzerland]].
*[[1386]] &ndash; Opening of the [[University of Heidelberg]].
*[[1540]] &ndash; Spanish conquistador [[Hernando de Soto]]'s forces destroy the fortified town of [[Mabila]] in present-day [[Alabama]], killing [[Tuskaloosa]].
*[[1599]] &ndash; [[Michael the Brave]], Prince of [[Wallachia]], defeats the Army of [[Andrew Bathory]] in the [[Battle of Şelimbăr]], leading to the first recorded unification of the Romanian people.
*[[1648]] &ndash; Boston Shoemakers form first U.S. [[trade union|labor organization]].
*[[1748]] &ndash; Signing of the [[Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle (1748)|Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle]] ends the [[War of the Austrian Succession]].
*[[1775]] &ndash; [[African-American]] poet [[Phillis Wheatley]] freed from slavery.
*  1775   &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: The [[Burning of Falmouth]] (now [[Portland, Maine]]) prompts the [[Continental Congress]] to establish the [[Continental Navy]].
*[[1779]] &ndash; American Revolutionary War: The Franco-American [[Siege of Savannah]] is lifted.
*[[1797]] &ndash; [[Treaty of Campo Formio]] is signed between [[France]] and [[Austria]]
*[[1851]] &ndash; [[Herman Melville]]'s ''[[Moby-Dick]]'' is first [[Publishing|published]] as ''The Whale'' by [[Richard Bentley]] of [[London]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; The [[Second Opium War]] finally ends at the [[Convention of Peking]] with the ratification of the [[Treaty of Tientsin]], an [[Unequal Treaties (China)|unequal treaty]].
*[[1867]] &ndash; [[United States]] [[Alaska Purchase|takes possession of]] [[Alaska]] after purchasing it from [[Russia]] for $7.2&nbsp;million. Celebrated annually in the state as [[Alaska Day]].
*[[1898]] &ndash; [[United States]] takes possession of [[Puerto Rico]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: [[Peter I of Serbia]] issues a declaration "To the Serbian People", as Serbia joins the war.
*[[1914]] &ndash; The [[Schoenstatt|Schoenstatt Movement]] is founded in [[Germany]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; The Crimean Autonomous Soviet Socialist Republic is formed as part of the [[RSFSR]].
*[[1922]] &ndash; The [[BBC|British Broadcasting Company]] (later Corporation) <!-- Not 'Corporation' yet ! --> is founded by a [[consortium]], to establish a nationwide network of [[radio transmitter]]s to provide a national [[broadcasting]] service.
*[[1929]] &ndash; The [[Judicial Committee of the Privy Council]] overrules the [[Supreme Court of Canada]] in ''[[Edwards v. Canada (Attorney General)|Edwards v. Canada]]'' when it declares that women are considered "Persons" under [[Canadian law]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[Soviet Union]] begins liberation of [[Czechoslovakia]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; The [[USSR]]'s nuclear program receives plans for the [[United States]] [[Nuclear weapon|plutonium bomb]] from [[Klaus Fuchs]] at the [[Los Alamos National Laboratory]].
*  1945   &ndash; A group of the [[Venezuela]]n Armed Forces, led by Mario Vargas, [[Marcos Pérez Jiménez]] and [[Carlos Delgado Chalbaud]], stages [[1945 Venezuelan coup d'état|a coup d'état]] against then president [[Isaías Medina Angarita]], who is overthrown by the end of the day.
*  1945   &ndash; [[Argentina|Argentine]] [[military officer]] and [[politician]] [[Juan Perón]] marries [[actress]] [[Eva Perón|Eva Duarte]].
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Texas Instruments]] announces the first [[Transistor radio]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; The [[1964 New York World's Fair|1964-1965 New York World's Fair]] closes for its first season after a six-month run.
*[[1967]] &ndash; The [[Soviet Union|Soviet]] probe [[Venera 4]] reaches [[Venus]] and becomes the first spacecraft to measure the atmosphere of another planet.
*[[1968]] &ndash; The [[U.S. Olympic Committee]] suspends [[Tommie C. Smith|Tommie Smith]] and [[John Carlos]] for giving a "[[black power]]" salute during a victory ceremony at the [[1968 Summer Olympics|Mexico City games]].
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[German Autumn]]: a set of events revolving around the [[kidnapping]] of [[Hanns Martin Schleyer|Hanns-Martin Schleyer]] and the [[Aircraft hijacking|hijacking]] of a [[Lufthansa]] flight by the [[Red Army Faction]] (RAF) comes to an end when Schleyer is murdered and various RAF members allegedly commit [[suicide]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The Supreme Council of [[Azerbaijan]] adopts a declaration of independence from the [[Soviet Union]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Bolivian Gas War]]: [[List of presidents of Bolivia|President]] [[Gonzalo Sánchez de Lozada]], is forced to resign and leave [[Bolivia]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Myanmar]] prime minister [[Khin Nyunt]] is ousted and placed under house arrest by the [[State Peace and Development Council]] on charges of corruption.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[2007 Karachi bombings|Karachi bombings]]: A suicide attack on a motorcade carrying former [[Pakistan]]i [[Prime Minister of Pakistan|Prime Minister]] [[Benazir Bhutto]] kills 139 and wounds 450 more. Bhutto herself is not injured.
